artist: Artist: Chō Tōsai; Author: inscribed by Totoki Baigai
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: two delicate stalks of bamboo, one black, one grey, rising from bottom; smaller, shorter stalk at bottom; two line inscription ULQ; longer inscription LRQ
markings: L side when rolled, Japanese inscription; ULQ, square intaglio:趙養; ULQ, square relief:息心居士; R center, square relief: ?; LRQ, square intaglio: 時賜; LRQ, square relief: 清梦;  R side when rolled, Japanese label
signed: UL:安永戊戌二月朔枸杞園陶斎筆(Painted in the beginning of Apirl of 1778, Kuko-en, Chō Tōsai) ; LR:壬戍之秋門生酔学士梅厓賜?題(Fall of 1802, inscrpited by the disciple, Yo-Gakushi Baigai Shyaku)
title: Bamboo
